thread.title: Hayes, Koenig, Ellenson on watch lists for national awards
thread.title_full: Hayes, Koenig, Ellenson on watch lists for national awards

title: Hayes, Koenig, Ellenson on watch lists for national awards
text:
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE MADISON, Wis. (AP) â€” Two players from the University of Wisconsin and one from Marquette are on watch lists for national basketball awards.
Badger Nigel Hayes is among 20 candidates for the Julius Erving Small Forward of the Year Award, while teammate Bronson Koenig is on the watch list for the Bob Cousy Award, recognizing the top point guard.
Hayes started all 40 games for Wisconsin last season, finishing with 12.4 points per game and 6.2 rebounds per game. Koenig started the final 24 games last season, averaging 11.5 points and 2.7 assists per game.
Marquette freshman Henry Ellenson of Rice Lake, Wisconsin, is on the watch list for the 2016 Karl Malone Power Forward of the Year Award.
The Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame announced the watch lists Tuesday. Each list will be narrowed to 10 in mid-February.
